extendedIngredients.name: cornbread
extendedIngredients.original: 2 lbs prepared cornbread, cut into 3/4-inch cubes (12 cups)
extendedIngredients.originalName: prepared cornbread, cut into 3/4-inch cubes (12 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: pork sausage
extendedIngredients.original: 1 lb fresh pork sausage, casings removed, crumbled (plus giblets, diced; optional)
extendedIngredients.originalName: fresh pork sausage, casings removed, crumbled (plus giblets, diced; optional)

title: Cornbread And Sausage Stuffing
summary: The recipe Cornbread And Sausage Stuffing could satisfy your Southern craving in around 1 hour and 40 minutes. This recipe makes 10 servings with 477 calories, 15g of protein, and 22g of fat each. For $1.23 per serving, this recipe covers 14% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Head to the store and pick up celery, coarse salt and ground pepper, chicken broth, and a few other things to make it today. This recipe is liked by 147 foodies and cooks. It works well as an affordable side dish for Thanksgiving. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 53%. This score is solid. Try Cornbread & Sausage Stuffing, Sausage Cornbread Stuffing, and Cornbread Sausage Stuffing for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Cornbread works really well with Riesling, Sparkling Wine, and Zinfandel. In general, there are a few rules that will help you pair wine with southern food. Food-friendly riesling or sparkling white wine will work with many fried foods, while zinfandel is great with barbecued fare. The Fess Parker Santa Barbara Riesling with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 9 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Fess Parker Santa Barbara Riesling
productMatches.description: Floral notes and orange blossoms, commingle with scents of citrus, peach, honeysuckle and light apricot on the nose. On the palate you will find flavors of peach, apricot and citrus. These flavors combine to produce an off-dry, yet well-balanced Riesling.
